thread.title: Victoria Beckham wears Adidas in show of support to David | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Victoria Beckham wears Adidas in show of support to David | Daily Mail Online

author: Rebecca Davison For Mailonline
title: Victoria Beckham wears Adidas in show of support to David | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 137 shares She teamed it with a simple white top and kept out the cold wearing a black coat which was buttoned up at the front and she carried a half-moon black leather bag on her shoulder from her own collection. Carrying her drink in hand, she still looked glamorous as she headed back to her car with her short brunette locks teased into pretty curls. Under fire: Victoria's husband David is back home in London after being caught up in an email scandal. In the leak, David reacted angrily when he had been passed over for a knighthood Brand love: David has been an ambassador for the sportswear brand for a number of years With a full face of make-up, she hid her eyes behind a dark pair of designer shades as she prepared for her busy week ahead. Victoria has been across the pond working on her latest collection for New York Fashion Week. With her runway presentation scheduled for Sunday it's no doubt been a busy time for the star, who has come under fire from fans for pushing her brand amid her husband's email scandal. A good sport: Victoria still managed to look incredible in her low-key choice of attire, wearing the brand's trademark tracksuit pants and the iconic shell-toe trainers Wrapped up: She teamed it with a simple white top and kept out the cold wearing a black coat which was buttoned up at the front It's all going on: With a full face of make-up, she hid her eyes behind a dark pair of designer shades as she prepared for her busy week ahead As she tried to focus on her own business by sharing products from her Spring/Summer collection on Monday, the backlash turned on her - with critics slamming her for her husband's emails and for using slim models. After sharing an image of her collection, one angry tweeter wrote: 'Anorexic chic was so yesterday!' Another user accused the former Spice Girl of arrogance, adding: 'u had a 'small' girl band a 100 yrs ago get over it. u r by no means a rock or any legend. move on honey. arrogant (sic).' Looking good: Carrying her drink in hand, she still looked glamorous as she headed back to her car with her short brunette locks teased into pretty curls Low profile: With a full face of make-up, she hid her eyes behind a dark pair of designer shades as she prepared for her busy week ahead Hard times: With her runway scheduled for Sunday it's no doubt been a busy time for the star, who has come under fire from fans for pushing her brand amid husband David's email scandal Then came the criticism over David's emails: 'Sorry your husband has lost the plot he said what he said he need to get over it. (sic)' One quipped: 'Tell David its about time people can now see what he is really like. He stopped becoming a footballer when he met you.' In the leak, David reacted angrily when he found out he had been passed over for a knighthood. The former England captain branded the Honours Committee ‘unappreciative c***s’ and dismissed lower awards, ranting: ‘Unless it’s a knighthood f*** off’. According to the revelations, the Honours Committee had already agreed that Beckham's nomination – almost certainly proposed by his PR advisers – was well 'merited' before a routine check of his tax affairs. The leaked emails also include a number of bombshells and series of sweary-rants and may even have been used as part of a £1million blackmail plot. In one message the ex-England captain allegedly claims singer Katherine Jenkins, 36, got an OBE for ‘singing at the rugby and going to see the troops plus taking coke. F g joke’. Off she goes: Earlier in the day, Victoria was pictured leaving her New York hotel as she prepared to get to work Share or comment on this article 137
